locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the Kenosis (emptying) of Christ, contrasting human fantasies of power (Laurie Anderson) with the historical and theological reality of the cross.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Detailed focus on 'morphe' and 'doulos', contextualizing the shame of crucifixion.

illocutie.beschrijving: Predominantly asserting the nature of Christ's sacrifice, transitioning into a promise of transformation at the end.
voorbeelden: Jesus rewrote the book of love.
He stepped into our place.
This love now is given to you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a sense of 'fantasy' religion to a participation in the 'mind of Christ'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The sermon mentions God 'breaking through', but lacks explicit invocation of the Spirit's agency.

voorbeelden: Christ Jesus was in the form of God.
Paul says he hopes that all the people...
It was a method specifically designed to be degrading.
Let’s look back at Laurie Anderson.
Let’s see if we can grasp this next idea.
What steps can you take to rewrite your own story?
I don’t know.
It’s hard for me to imagine.
I remember to this day.
He is going to make us beautiful.
He is going to give us all his riches.
This love now is given to you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but late. The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is concentrated in the final third.

voorbeelden: You are the 'ugly people'.
We receive it into our hearts.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher identifies the congregation's status but relies more on description than direct sacramental pronouncement.

indicatoren: Lengthy analysis of Laurie Anderson's lyrics
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a 'Big Idea' rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Immediate sacramental address ('I tell you now...')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final paragraphs.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological resonance, linking 'ugly people' to 'riches'.
voorbeelden: He is going to make us beautiful.
This love now is given to you.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used primarily for rhetorical questions and final application.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the 'ugly people' metaphor.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the exegesis of Paul, Christ, and Laurie Anderson.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel in the middle section.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical narrative of the Cross and Paul's ministry.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about human nature and God's character.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now' of the sermon and the upcoming Communion.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (The Cross) to the Commissive (The Promise) to the Directive (The Mind of Christ).
voorbeelden: Jesus rewrote the book... He is going to make us beautiful... Rejoice!
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Theologically sound, though the Assertive phase is disproportionately long.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he has rewritten the story, we do not have to be prisoners... move toward being of the same mind.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon excels at explaining the 'why' and 'how' of the Gospel, culminating in a strong promise of grace.

sterke_punten.effect: Makes the declarative force of the Gospel relatable.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy section on church carpet fights and Laurie Anderson.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the performative 'event' of the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the preacher addresses the 'ugly people' directly with the promise.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strong connection to the 'Word' and 'Communion' as the locus of receiving Christ.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strong. The preacher speaks as one unfolding a 'Big Idea' that is not human.
tekstueel_bewijs: We receive it into our hearts when we hear this Word.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the 'miracle of rewriting' is attributed to God's breakthrough.
tekstueel_bewijs: God may break through with yet another miracle.
The Cross reveals to us just how godless we really were.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'Paul says' (Assertive) to 'Christ promises you' (Commissive) earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus rewrote the book of love.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, Jesus rewrites the book of your life.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a historical fact to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The toezegging is already the strongest part.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you: your story is being rewritten.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to implicate the hearer in the 'form of a slave' section.
voorbeeldzinnen: He became a slave for you.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A theologically rich sermon that successfully navigates from a cultural hook to a sacramental promise. To move to 'Excellent', reduce the constative 'talking about' the text and increase the performative 'doing' of the text.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies the 'Declarative' (You are the ugly people) which SvT would merely see as 'Information' or 'Self-disclosure'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Focuses on the authority of the promise rather than the cleverness of the Laurie Anderson illustration.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: Reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the 'Commissives' at the end, identifying the middle as a 'Constative Surplus'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He is going to make us beautiful.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Big Idea' locution, but the illocutionary force of the 'Toezegging' saves it from being a mere lecture.
